intro: Scleranthus foliosus, commonly known as the leafy sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields. The plant has slender, erect stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, five-petaled, and usually pink or white, blooming in early summer. Scleranthus foliosus is an annual plant that produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds.
